alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Craig, northeastern Rogers, Delaware, southern Ottawa and Mayes Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 814 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near White Oak to 8 miles south of Chouteau. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Jay... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Grove... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Fairland... Afton... West Siloam Springs... Langley... Colcord... Kansas... Adair... Bernice... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Wyandotte... Disney... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 266 and 300. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
